typedef struct exception except_t

A datatype to help implement exception handling thrown A quasi-Boolean value indicating if an exception was thrown (1) or not (0). type A short string to describe the type of exception thrown

curlyqueue_node_t *  next 
)

Creates new list node

Precondition:
calling fn has determined prev and next pointers
Postcondition:
mem has been allocated for new node and and node field values have been assigned
Note:
calling fn must free mem!

void curly_destroy_queue ( curlyqueue_t *  queue  ) 

Rolls through list, freeing resources.

Parameters:
queue the q to destroy
Precondition:
the queue pointer is not NULL
Postcondition:
all nodes in the list are freed

the list manager's pointers are set to null

the list manager's count is decremented for each freed node

the current node

the node after current node
